results.title: Flight plan
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Stanley Hawes
results.brief_description: The organisation of ciial aviation in Australia; the planning and control behind, and during, every flight; the training of pilots and maintenance staff; plans for the future development of the service. Also features the Royal Flying Doctor Service.

results.title: Flight of the rhino
results.creator_credit: Sky Visuals, Tina Dalton and Gary Steer
results.brief_description: No other large wild animal is being wiped out at the rate of Africa’s black rhino. If this rate of slaughter continues the black rhino may not survive this decade. This video shows the extraordinary efforts that are being made in an attempt to save this animal from extinction. in a bid to svave them, rhinos are being dehorned, poachers are being shot on sight and rhinos are being transported to safe areas within Zimbabwe and to captive breeding centres overseas. Following the journey of nine black rhinos taken from the wilds of Zimbabwe and flown to Western Plains Zoo in outback Australia. It is hoped that the offspring of this herd will one day be returned to their home in Zimbabwe.

results.title: Flight of the navigator (Captioned)
results.brief_description: A 12 year old boy is mysteriously abducted by an alien ship and returns to earth eight years later, still only 12. He now possesses great navigational powers that enable him to fly his spaceship anywhere he desires. Along with the robotic commander Max and mascot Puckmarin, David encounters an adventure of extraterrestrial proportions. Stars Joey Cramer, Howard Hesseman, Veronica Cartwright and Cliff De Young. Based on a story by Mark H. Baker

results.title: Flight of the innocent = La Corsa dell' innocente
results.creator_credit: Cristaldifilm, Fandango, Franco Castaldi, Domenico Procacci and Carlo Carlei
results.brief_description: This breathtakingly visual film, the first feature by Carlo Carei, captures the emotions and arouses the senses. Since 1966, due to the depressed economy in southern Italy, kidnapping has become almost an alternative industry. Men, women and children, from the wealthy north are kidnapped and used as bartering chips by their merciless captors. Feuds develop between rival gangs. Many survive…others are not so fortunate. The story centres upon Vito, a young Italian child whose family are in the kidnapping business and are brutally murdered by a rival gang. He escapes on a perilous journey with the murderers in hot pursuit. Although “Flight of the innocent” is fictional, similar events to those depicted continue to occur. Italian dialogue. English subtitles.

results.title: Flight of the doves
results.brief_description: Constantly bullied by their cruel stepfather, Finn Dove and his young sister Derval decide to run away and find their grandmother in Ireland. They are chased by their wicked Uncle Hawk, a master of disguise, who is aware that the children are heirs to a fortune. Features Ron Moody, Jack Wild and Helen Rayne. Based on the book by Walter Macken.

results.title: Flight of the Amazon Queen for PC
results.creator_credit: John Passfield, WarnerActive and Interactive Binary Illusions
results.material_description: CD-ROM videogame. CD-ROM, CD jewel case with insert, manual, registration card and installation guide in cardboard box
results.brief_description: Science supervillains are popular across genres, and evil Dr Ironstein from Flight of the Amazon Queen is just such a nefarious mastermind. He has a secret underground bunker with a high-tech lab where he has developed the dino-ray to create an army of dinosaur women with which he plans to rule the world.

constellations_primary.name: Gender bending larrikins
constellations_primary.description: Australia has a long history with gender creativity and drag culture, both on screen and on stage.

results.title_for_label: Flight of the Amazon Queen for PC
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Passfield, WarnerActive and Interactive Binary Illusions
results.description:
When Joe King arrives at a Buenos Aires hotel to fly a movie star to a photo shoot, he’s ambushed by rivals who steal his clothes to detain him. To escape, Joe disguises himself as a showgirl and sets off to save the star and stop a mad scientist taking over the world.

Featuring a larrikin hero, Amazonian tribes and booby-trapped temples, you can see the influence of Indiana Jones on Flight of the Amazon Queen. Likewise, it features some outdated references and terminology, but John Passfield and Steven Stamatiadis’ game is emblematic of the popular 1990s point-and-click adventure genre, which often incorporated cinematic storytelling elements.

It’s inspired by games like LucasArts’ Monkey Island series (1990), which use on-screen directions like ‘use’, ‘open’, ‘talk to’ and ‘pick up’ to propel the gameplay. In another daring escape – this time down a laundry chute – Joe ‘picks up’ two sheets and ‘uses’ them to create a rope, just one of the many puzzles players solve.

The game has since been ported to smartphones, with the addition of improved graphics, full voice acting, multi-language support and a play through of the interactive interview mini-game with audio commentary by John Passfield, one of the game’s designers.
description_for_label:
When Joe King arrives at a Buenos Aires hotel to fly a movie star to a photo shoot, he’s ambushed by rivals who steal his clothes to detain him. To escape, Joe disguises himself as a showgirl and sets off to save the star and stop a mad scientist taking over the world.

Featuring a larrikin hero, Amazonian tribes and booby-trapped temples, you can see the influence of Indiana Jones on Flight of the Amazon Queen. Likewise, it features some outdated references and terminology, but John Passfield and Steven Stamatiadis’ game is emblematic of the popular 1990s point-and-click adventure genre, which often incorporated cinematic storytelling elements.

It’s inspired by games like LucasArts’ Monkey Island series (1990), which use on-screen directions like ‘use’, ‘open’, ‘talk to’ and ‘pick up’ to propel the gameplay. In another daring escape – this time down a laundry chute – Joe ‘picks up’ two sheets and ‘uses’ them to create a rope, just one of the many puzzles players solve.

The game has since been ported to smartphones, with the addition of improved graphics, full voice acting, multi-language support and a play through of the interactive interview mini-game with audio commentary by John Passfield, one of the game’s designers.

results.title: Flight of Apollo 7
results.creator_credit: Hearst Metrotone News and United States. National Aeronautics Space Administration
results.brief_description: Many remarkable and memorable shots of the Apollo 7 moon test flight which took place in October 1968. Shows the three astronauts Walter Schirra, Donn Eisele and Walter Cunningham in their cabin while in orbit.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hearst Metrotone News and United States. National Aeronautics Space Administration

results.title: Flight line one: controlled burning from aircraft
results.creator_credit: CSIRO, S.T. Evans and D.G. Corke
results.brief_description: Widespread controlled burning of Australian forests - reducing the amount of combustible litter on the ground by burning off at regular intervals - has often been proposed as a fire protection measure. This film shows how aircraft are used in the routine application of this technique in the Jarrah forests of Western Australia.

results.title: Flight into yesterday
results.creator_credit: Department of Civil Aviation, Australia, Ivern Hendrickson and Frank Burgess
results.brief_description: History of commercial aviation in Papua-New Guinea from the pioneering airfreight flights to the mountain goldfields to the present services. Narrated by Jim Berinson.
